meanings.sent1: I parked my car in the carlot near the mall.
meanings.sent2: The carlot was full of vehicles on a busy Saturday.
meanings.sent3: Why did the car cross the road? To get to the carlot on the other side!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a carlot of memories, each vehicle representing a different moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The carlot shimmered under the hot sun, a sea of metal and paint.

meanings.definition: A large quantity of cars sold together.
meanings.sent1: The dealership received a shipment of new cars and added them to the carlot.
meanings.sent2: The carlot at the auction was filled with various makes and models.
meanings.sent3: The carlot overflowed with vehicles, creating a colorful and bustling scene.
meanings.sent4: The carlot resembled a rainbow of automobiles, each shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The carlot stretched as far as the eye could see, a vast expanse of cars waiting for new owners.

meanings.definition: To sell cars in a large group.
meanings.sent1: The dealership decided to carlot their inventory to make room for new models.
meanings.sent2: They planned to carlot the used cars at a special event next weekend.
meanings.sent3: The salesman joked that he could carlot cars in his sleep, he was so experienced.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to carlot all the vehicles quickly to meet the monthly sales target.
meanings.sent5: The decision to carlot the cars together proved to be a successful strategy for the business.
